Name: The Sacred Breeze So Often Breathes
QuestDesc: After a minor twist in the journey, Ragunna, the Land of Echoes, unfolds its grandeur, extending a grand welcome to the traveler from distant shores.

Unlock.Name: Veils Off in Sun or Shadow

Chapters.Title: Fast travel to the beacon at the Lighthouse of Dawn

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, where to next?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go get our money first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The invitation mentioned we could pick it up from Averardo Bank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you heading to the Averardo Bank, dear guest? Please take the Gondola along the canal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is your stop. Wish you a great day.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola to Averardo Bank

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A gift from one of Rinascita's founding families... It's bound to be a hefty sum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Awesome! Once we have it, let's treat ourselves to a meal at a restaurant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm actually starving now... Not even joking...

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola to Averardo Bank

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been expecting you, {PlayerName}. Welcome to Averardo Bank, {Male=sir;Female=miss}.

Options.PlotLineKey: You are?
Do I know you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Zani, a staff member here. The Montelli family ordered me to welcome you and assist with accessing your fund.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I ask where your companion is...

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, Abby's sleeping now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Understood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your fund is ready. Please follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may present your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mercurio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beep—beep—

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe this is your first time using our service. As the Montelli family's esteemed guest, we're upgrading your account to Gold Membership.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mercurio here will sort out your subscription. He's about as lively as a cash machine, so give him a moment.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this Mercurio also an Echo?
Even the cash machine is an Echo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, all Echoes here belong to the Montelli family. Mercurio's designed to provide self-service banking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montellis also put me in charge as your bodyguard and tour guide for Ragunna. If you want to see the city before the Carnevale, I can arrange a travel itinerary. Perhaps a Thundering Mephis type of outing may suit you, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a popular choice for visiting all the tourist attractions quickly, though I wouldn't bother with it personally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This assignment was very last-minute. I apologize if I am not familiar with your personal travel preferences. Please excuse any oversights on my part.

Options.PlotLineKey: No need to be so formal...
Don't worry, I like to find my own way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not at all. The Montellis always treat their guests with hospitality. I'm simply following their lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I am here to assist if you change your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mercurio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beep—beep—

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fund has been deposited into your account. Is there anything else you need help with?

Options.PlotLineKey: Are there any good restaurants nearby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The nearest one is Trattoria Margherita. I personally recommend Pizza Tropicale. Would you like to dine there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I have some work to handle. Please excuse me for a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last lots for the auction have arrived and will be escorted back by designated Echoes. Make sure you get them on time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep an eye on No. 23 and 56—they're foreign curiosities insured by Mr. Lombardi. Don't screw it up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the details are in the memo... Okay, I'll leave it to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry to keep you waiting. I'll take you to the restaurant now.

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems like a packed schedule... Is everything alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, thank you for asking. The Bank is short-staffed due to secondments, so I'm handling a few extra things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Normally, I wouldn't take on extra assignments, but my manager promised some paid days off, and the Montellis can be very gener—

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem. Sorry, too much. I'll do my best to meet your needs during your stay here.

Options.PlotLineKey: You can loosen up a bit.
Don't stress on my behalf.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry about me, I can handle myself without involving the Montellis. I'm not one for formalities, so let's keep it relaxed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...If that's what you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. All that formality was starting to feel like exercise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go get something to eat, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Following the instructions on your invitation, you head to the Averardo Bank to collect the funds prepared by the Montelli family.

Zani, a bank employee, has been expecting you. Acting on the Montelli family's orders, Zani serves as both your guide and bodyguard during your time in Ragunna.

After some brief introductions, Zani suggests it‘s time to try some local delicacies. After all the twists and turns on the way, it's high time to reward your stomach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to Trattoria Margherita!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ciao, Zani! Knocking off early today, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not really... still on duty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? You seem alright, considering. So, what will it be today? The "Adios, Workdays" or the "Thank Goodness It's the Holiday" platter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The last one. Thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this {Male=gentleman;Female=lady} here... A visitor from afar? It's a pleasure.

Options.PlotLineKey: I am her guest.
I am Zani's new friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. You certainly have the air of someone who matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, look at this. You can order anything you like. The Montellis are getting the bill.

Options.PlotLineKey: Any recommendations?
I'll have two portions of the platter Zani just ordered.
Bring me all your specials!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about Steak Margherita and Nuvola Pasta? Both excellent choices!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The woman speaks the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, good choice! Zani's taste will never let you down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No offense but... you sure you can eat all that by yourself?

Options.PlotLineKey: That's the least of my worries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take a seat! Your meals will be ready soon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You’re taken to Trattoria Margherita, the most popular restaurant in Ragunna.
Zani tells you to order whatever you like, as the Montelli family’s covering the bill.

Chapters.Title: Find a seat and sit down

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's your food. Enjoy!

Options.PlotLineKey: (Wake up, Abby. Food's ready.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Sniffs* Oh what's that smell... it's so good!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're... Abby, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi there... Gosh, this tastes amazing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zani. Nice to meet you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did not expect to see an Echo residing in a Resonator's body... Interesting.

Options.PlotLineKey: Even someone from the Land of Echoes finds it surprising?
Have you ever seen Echoes like Abby？

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, foreign Echoes aren't exactly a daily sight here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Can't say I have. Why do you sound like you're helping a lost kid find their home...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Told ya! I'm always the most special one! Mmm, this is so good!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, let's dig in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You will enjoy the food, of course. We Ragunnesi take pride in our food traditions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For instance, never overcook seafood, or you'll ruin its natural taste. Always serve freshwater fish before sea fish, or its tender flavor will be masked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd start with this appetizer. It complements the main course—hearty but not too heavy, perfect for those burning the midnight oil.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And don't forget the aperitif. As we say, "If you can't appreciate good wine, you don't deserve good water."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, try the Nectarwine from Egla Town. It's aged in oak barrels from the Fagaceae Peninsula, known as the "Harvest Spirit" or "Gocce di Divino" for its exceptional flavor.

Options.PlotLineKey: So this is the Gocce di Divino.
(Raise the glass.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To you, guests from afar...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...and my vacation that never seems to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... nothing beats a good meal... Wait, what's the buzz over there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Probably the Montelli's Echo show. They've been rehearsing for days, getting ready to perform it for the Sentinel at Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Intrigued, are we? The formal event will be even more spectacular.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you are enjoying the meal, the cheers from nearby catch your attention.
According to Zani, it is a rehearsal for the Echo Dance performance prepared by the Montelli family…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!
Command...
Unify...
Ascend...
Converge...
Thou hast come at last... I am the Imperator. Aid me, O Arbiter... that we may return the Lost unto the earthly realm!

Dialogues.Speaker: Acolyte of the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The other one's gotten loose... Hey! It's getting away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Acolyte of the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Lycoris petal lies on the ground, emanating an ominous aura...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You vaguely remember seeing this kind of flower before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A private gathering is currently underway ahead, and entry is restricted to members of the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Meticulous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, esteemed guest. There is a private gathering underway ahead, and entry is restricted to members of the Order. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Meticulous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Primus is currently unavailable for an audience. If you have matters requiring the Order’s consideration, please consult with Priest Alessio.

Dialogues.Speaker: Meticulous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should you wish to enter the Cathedral of Mercury, please proceed through the main door.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you stands a man clad in pure white—or rather, a hologram of him—and his grand throne.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though merely a projection, there is an undeniable gravity and majesty to his presence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be Fenrico, the Primus of the Order of the Deep, just as Priest Alessio described.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what you’ve gathered and experienced, it seems clear that he is the Resonator of the Sentinel, Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You take a moment to study his figure. A golden mask conceals half of his face, while the other half reveals a deep furrow in his brow. His gaze lowered, carrying an unreadable expression. What lies behind it? Compassion? Or perhaps something deeper, such as... an unspeakable grief?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why would he leave this projection in the Cathedral?

Options.PlotLineKey: (To oversee everything?)
(To offer a silent reassurance?)
(Or simply to impress, because it looks… cool?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you mull over these questions, a sudden chill creeps over you. For a fleeting moment, you feel as if his gaze has shifted, directed straight at you. But when you look again, his face is unchanged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it an illusion? You can’t be sure. But for now, you’d best focus on tracking down the channel Gilberto used to make his escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was that… Mr. Gilberto from the Fisalia family? Why was he in such a rush?

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The way he went, looks like he’s off to"seek forgiveness."

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, may the Sentinel guide him to "salvation"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don’t think I’ve seen these two before. Judging by their outfits… they don’t really look like the Order’s followers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Probably some guests invited by Priest Alessio. Can’t put our fingers on the higher-ups’ business, anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That’s true. Under the Sentinel’s sheltering wing, we’re all kin as long as we walk in righteousness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if they break the rules… well, that’s a different story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah ah...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't wait for the Carnevale to come!

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gonna get back to work once I finish this drink... Hic.

Dialogues.Speaker: A Data Message
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Path ahead, time for repentance.  —Zani

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was so scary! I really thought Bakie was gonna lose control just like that Vitreum Dancer…

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, you really shouldn’t have had to go through such a rough experience on your first visit to Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take these dishes—they’re on the house! Hope this keeps your day on the bright side!

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An Echo attacking humans? Right before the Carnevale? That’s wild…

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 2
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rumor has it, the Montelli family’s Echoes are "filthy"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Analytical Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An Echo attacking humans? Right before the Carnevale? That’s wild…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rumor has it, the Montelli family's Echoes are "filthy"—none of them have been purified by the Order...

Dialogues.Speaker: Analytical Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I’ve heard whispers, but those Montelli Echoes have been helping out around the city for ages without a single issue… until now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The real problem isn’t the Echoes but their Reserved Terminals!

Dialogues.Speaker: Analytical Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Isn’t all that Montelli tech based on the Genesis Nexus? They always insist it’s completely safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, that's just their sales pitch. When has a business ever told you the downside of their product?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They’re even planning to push more Reserved Terminals during the Carnevale. That can't be more suspicious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Analytical Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But isn’t the Montelli family hosting the Carnevale this year?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doesn’t matter. They’re businesspeople. Who knows what they’re really up to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Analytical Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep blathering on about this without a shred of evidence and you could end up before the <ano=The Secular Court> of the Order's Tribunal</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chattering Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, fine, I’m just saying…

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Montellis are behind this mess? Ha! Now that would be top-shelf entertainment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, isn’t the Montellis the one pushing this whole Carnevale? And they can’t even control their own Echoes? A Vitreum Dancer show? Really, that’s their big idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They keep saying it’s for the people, but who actually buys that? It’s all about the money, fame, and power for them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ignoring past "truths," shrugging off the Order's warnings, disregarding public safety!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are they just going to ignore divine will, or worse, go against the Sentinel? Heh, classic Montellis! Always "bold and pioneering"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe… they just want to humiliate themselves at the Carnevale. Haha, that’d be top-shelf entertainment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gloating Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just wait. Once the Order hands down their verdict, the Montellis’ so-called glory days will be over.

Chapters.Title: Track the Echo that lost control

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright? It's strange. Why did that Echo suddenly lose control…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine. Something's off with those Echoes. Let's try calming them down.

Chapters.Title: Track the Echo that lost control
Track the Echo that lost control
Stop the Echo that lost control

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Vitreum Dancer suddenly lost control... Luckily, no one got hurt.

Options.PlotLineKey: Actually...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You brief her on what you just saw.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that I think about it, the frequency vibration I sensed felt a lot like... empathy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Empathy…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, maybe telepathy? Not sure. It's hard to explain…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Telepathy… Yes, according to legend, the Sentinel speaks directly into the mind of the Laureate. Could that be what happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the "Imperator" is the Sentinel. But who's the "Lost"? Plus, it said it needs your help, but… a Sentinel shouldn't need to ask for help, wouldn't ya say? Eh, something's not adding up, what a headache...

Options.PlotLineKey: We need to learn how the Sentinel talks to people.
That Vitreum Dancer was trying to tell me something…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Sentinel has countless ways to send a message, and through the Order is apparently the most convenient one, but why did they go through all the trouble...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Maybe I'm wrong. Maybe calling for help was the only option?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (With that message left on Tethys… Could the Sentinel here be in a situation similar to Jué's?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But it seems like the locals haven't laid eyes on their Sentinel. Everything feels off. That Echo might be our only lead right now.)

Options.PlotLineKey: Was the Echo performance hosted by the Montellis?
I want to find out what caused that Echo to lose control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was. The Montelli family has been promoting the use of Reserved Terminals and Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As far as I know, the Montelli family has been promoting the use of Reserved Terminals and Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most Ragunnesi use Common Echoes and don't know much about the Reserved ones. The Montellis spotted a chance and started researching Reserved Terminals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They push to bring back the Carnevale so they can showcase their Reserved Terminals, prove the quality of their Echoes, and attract both customers and investors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh sorry, just a minute.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Mr. Alberto. An Echo was...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zani recounts what happened to the caller. Moments later...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry to keep you waiting. That was Mr. Alberto from the Montelli family. Also my employer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He extends a sincere apology for what just happened. They too are at a loss to explain what caused the accident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He told me that the Montelli family would investigate further. Please rest assured.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did the Montellis really have no answers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... After all, such an incident only hinders their promotion of Reserved Terminals. They have no reason to rejoice over it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, that Echo... it was looking at you. It seemed to target you.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've got sharp eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, I won't pry into my ward's privacy. I only remember what I need to get the job done. Anything else I accidentally overhear just slips my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My orders are to guard and to guide. I do my job. Nothing more, nothing less. So if you want to investigate, I'll stick with you until you're done.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you.
You're very professional!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't thank me, thank the family who hired me. Their generosity is beyond what you can imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for trusting in my abilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what's our next move?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's find that Vitreum Dancer first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was complete chaos, but I spied the direction it fled… We can try our luck at the Pioneer Association.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know someone there whose Forte might help us uncover some details we missed.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure, let's head to the Pioneer Association first.
Well, I think we'd better work the scene first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Let's go this way. It's right over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No problem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
During the Carnevale rehearsal, one of the Vitreum Dancers suddenly loses control and charges into the crowd. Amid the chaos, your mind connects with the Dancer's and you hear the voice of the Sentinel. They ask for your help in bringing the Lost back to the earthly realm.

After pondering these words, you suspect that Imperator, like the Sentinel of Jinzhou, might be in a vulnerable state, relying on Echoes to communicate. But all your questions could only be answered by that Vitreum Dancer.

You ask Zani about the Dancer and the rehearsal. She explains that it's not a Common Echo, but a private one owned by the Montellis. They're pushing the use of Reserved Terminals, and this Carnevale is their opportunity to promote them. The incident with the dancer could cause a major setback for them.

The Vitreum Dancer you connected with has already escaped. Zani suggests finding a Resonator from the Pioneer Association if you want to track it down. But if you'd like to investigate the scene first, she's happy to help.
Here's to a world of discoveries and wonders! Welcome to the Pioneer Association!
Ms. Zani! It's been some time! Have you finally decided to join us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm here for something else. This is Mr. Fulmine from the Pioneer Association.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hello! You've brought a new friend! Pleasure to meet you. I'm Fulmine, head of the Wutherium Film Studio under the Pioneer Association in Ragunna. How should I address you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Nice to meet you, I'm {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your name rings a bell… Oh! Y-you're the legendary Rover?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Savior from a foreign land, the dark thunderbolt streaking across the world… I've longed to meet you! By the Sentinel, let me seize this extraordinary moment!

Options.PlotLineKey: They're just titles, not worth bragging about.
Let's get down to business.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, you're actually some kind of celebrity?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, indeed {Male=he;Female=she} is. Ragunna's routes have only recently opened, so {Male=his;Female=her} feats haven't made it here yet. Should you perform a great deed, trust me to ensure your name echoes throughout Ragunna!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had a nagging feeling I've met someone important... But let's get back to what matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're here to ask a favor. We're investigating a Vitreum Dancer who caused a scene around Trattoria Margherita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're here to ask a favor. We're investigating a Vitreum Dancer who caused a scene around Trattoria Margherita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It fled in this direction, and we're wondering if you can recreate the scene for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I know the one you mean. Saw it streaking out of the city with a few Order fellows in tow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for recreating the scene… C-MOSS, my friend, it's time to get to work!

Dialogues.Speaker: C-MOSS
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, where is it? My memory of that Vitreum Dancer… Ah, I've found it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Fulmine's Forte is Celluloid Chronicle. He can convert events into film, recording all that happens within a span of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His partner, C-MOSS, uses a "Memory Projector" Forte to show these captured moments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There it is! Take a look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it did leave the city… This complicates matters. The area beyond is too vast to search effectively. Plus, Tacet Discords are hampering our investigation. We can't start searching just yet.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Abby, can you sniff it out?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (…What do you think I am? Not a chance! And I'm too sleepy to help, just wake me if there's any progress…)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. I can only record what is plain to the eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be hard on yourself, Mr. Fulmine. You've been a tremendous help. At least we're not flying blind anymore. But {PlayerName}, we need a new plan.

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you think back carefully?
Was anything unusual?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Give me a moment. Ah, yes! Look at this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could this be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His garb suggests he's from the Montelli family. Could they be involved in this turmoil?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's too soon to tell.
He wore an unusual mask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. But it's rare to wear a mask before the Carnevale. He must have wanted to hide his face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of, the mask is not the typical Montelli style, and wearing it now is unusual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With their eagerness to promote Reserved Terminals, the Montellis would be the last to invite trouble now. If he's tied to the disturbance...

Options.PlotLineKey: He may be a spy or in disguise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then perhaps we should seek Ms. Nyarla's expertise. She's known for her intricate masks, and this one seems custom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good idea, but nobles are secretive. Direct questions might lead to unwanted attention.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have a plan.
I'll arrange for a custom-made mask myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah-ha, Excellent. Let's make for the Masked Reverie.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your assistance, Mr. Fulmine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good luck!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Fulmine from the Pioneer Association has a unique skill: he can turn his memories into special film reels, and assisted by the Echo, C-MOSS, he can project those memories for others to see.

In one of Fulmine's memories, you see someone dressed in Montelli attire, wearing a mask and lurking suspiciously behind the Vitreum Dancer. Since the Carnevale hasn't started yet, it's odd for someone to already be masked up—as if they're deliberately hiding their identity.

With this clue, you decide to head to Masked Reverie, a mask shop, in search of leads…

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dear Sentinel above…

Options.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, do you know anything about the Echo that lost control?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the Sentinel is in a great rage! They are warning us, reminding us of our follies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shouldn't have forgotten... Ten years ago, it was our unbridled indulgence that brought about divine punishment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should have heeded Primus Fenrico's words…

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you mean?
What happened ten years ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, dear visitor from afar, you may not know. Ten years ago, the Carnevale angered the Sentinel and brought forth divine punishment. Primus Fenrico foresaw the shadow beneath the revelry and halted its spread!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, many terrible accidents happened during that Carnevale, like Echoes losing control. Since then, the Primus ordered the Carnevale to stop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most Ragunnesi don't like to talk about that tragedy, so it's understandable you haven't heard of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echoes are messengers of the Sentinel. They lost control and attacked people because they were corrupted, reflecting our transgressions against the Sentinel!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This year, the Order has approved the Carnevale. We will return to our traditions… Dear visitor, please join us in praising the Sentinel. Only then can our misguided souls be forgiven…

Options.PlotLineKey: How will that Echo be handled?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It may be a divine blessing, but it has committed an assault against the Sentinel's people. The corrupted will be purified under the holy light of the Genesis Nexus. As for the one that escaped, the Order will retrieve it as soon as possible to prevent further harm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, the Echo will be reset in the Data Bank. That's how we Ragunnesi usually deal with malfunctioning Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nervous Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We deeply apologize for the disturbance caused by that undisciplined Echo… Now, please excuse me. I have other matters to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Acolyte leaves while murmuring to herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She may not have given us anything useful, but she did remind me of one thing—that Vitreum Dancer's behavior was different from those Echoes that went wild in the past. It seemed to have a clear goal and a sentience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Echoes are connected with each other, so usually if one loses control, the others will be affected too. However, we haven't received any reports of other Echoes losing control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it wasn't the Sentinel's punishment, it could have been…

Options.PlotLineKey: …caused by someone.
Let's pick up the pace and find that Vitreum Dancer still at large.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. We need to catch it before the Order does, or we won't be able to get the information we need.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Go to the Montelli Quarter to investigate

Dialogues.Speaker: Timoteo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, Antonio, surely you know how things work here. It's always about who pays more. Is there a problem?

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you Fisalias even honor contracts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timoteo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, since when do Montellis fret over such trivialities?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timoteo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Instead of whining, maybe focus on cleaning up the mess your Echoes caused. Ha ha ha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia man walks away, leaving Antonio fuming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you are…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, Sir Antonio. I'm Zani from the Averardo Bank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This {Male=gentleman;Female=lady} here is a distinguished guest of your family, {PlayerName}. {Male=He;Female=She} was attacked by a rogue Vitreum Dancer while dining, and we're investigating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so you're… Please accept my apologies! It's a relief to see you unscathed. We're as puzzled as you are about the Echo's behavior.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay, but there's something else I want to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Carlotta asked me to hold nothing back, so ask away.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about Reserved Terminals and Reserved Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, before I do, a little context first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Ragunna, the Order controls all Terminals for Echo use. They store Echoes in their Data Bank and only grant access after thorough screening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only a select few Resonators are permitted to carry a Reserved Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, most Ragunnesi rely on the Genesis Nexus and Common Echoes, with little need for the special access types.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, things have changed with Ragunna opening up to the greater Solaris. People want to travel, making Reserved Terminals essential for safety outside the Order's reach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see why demand is up. The Montellis saw an opportunity and started to develop them. After all, necessity is the mother of invention, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It should be celebrated, but some think we disrespect the Order's authority or even the Sentinel by doing this. The path forward has been... resistant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, if you ask me, I suspect the Fisalia family has been spreading slanders about us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We back the Carnevale to showcase our Reserved Terminals to the people. It's our chance to prove their worth and attract investors.

Options.PlotLineKey: And the Fisalia family has been standing in your way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh… The Fisalias have coerced our miners to break their contracts, seizing our largest vein and cutting off our Terminal supply.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say the Fisalias have been seen frequenting the Cathedral of Mercury. They must be in league with the Order. How else would they dare to seize our mine so boldly?

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it gets worse. With the Carnevale nearing and our Echoes malfunctioning, the family's Executor might have to step in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Carnevale is at risk. While we hope it brings fortune, the festival itself is what truly matters to us, just like the rest of Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must uncover why the Echo lost control. We cannot let the Fisalias use this to tarnish our reputation any further!

Options.PlotLineKey: I can help you with the investigation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That would be good for us, but it hardly seems proper to involve our esteemed guest in our troubles...

Options.PlotLineKey: I have my own reasons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, understood. Thank you! But I'm afraid we can't spare any of our own to assist you. Rest assured, the Montellis are always generous. Here's an advance. Once the matter is resolved, you'll be well-rewarded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take it. In Ragunna, if you want help, you must offer a reward and one only declines a reward when they refuse to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Antonio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's right. Please accept it. If that's all, I must be on my way. There are many matters to attend to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Antonio departs with a sigh. The weight on his shoulders seems heavier than before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what we know, the Montelli family has no motive for such incidents. They've been anticipating the Carnevale's arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Fisalia family is another story. They've been against the celebration from the start, perhaps they could be behind everything? But I don't understand, what could they hope to gain by stopping the Carnevale?

Options.PlotLineKey: The mystery continues.
Maybe it's related to the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do I feel like I've gotten myself into something above my pay grade…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... have a hunch, hm?

Options.PlotLineKey: Only investigation brings us answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has the perfume, compact, and jewelry set arrived?
Yes, they have. Would you like them now, or shall we deliver them to your residence before tonight?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tonight… No, I'll take them now.
…Of course. I'll have someone fetch them immediately. It won't take long.
Welcome to Masked Reverie. From masks to elegant garments and splendid stage props, we craft it all to order. How may I help you today, my dear?

Options.PlotLineKey: ...Who's there?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, so eager to skip the pleasantries, are we? I'm right here. Do I seem invisible, or are you simply ignoring me? I am... right behind you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madame Nyarla, I saw you. Your mask gave you away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, don't spoil my secret so soon. It's not every day I get such a charming visitor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, only by "hiding" oneself can the true beauty of a mask be revealed, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But scaring the guests is just your twisted sense of humor, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope this didn't bother you. <ano=Ombra Elusiva>Invisibility</ano> is Madame Nyarla's Forte. Madame Nyarla, this is the distinguished guest invited by the Montellis, {PlayerName}. {Male=He;Female=She} is very interested in Carnevale masks.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, I'd like a custom-made mask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You elaborate on the mask design you saw in Fulmine's memory to Nyarla.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? That's quite a detailed description, even covering the smallest intricacies... I admit, I'm surprised.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not long ago, we customized a mask just like the one you've described.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Carnevale is a dream shared by all Ragunnesi, then a well-crafted mask is the key to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When faces are hidden, souls break free from the shackles of everyday life. That's why we love balls and plays, eagerly awaiting the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Masks liberate our spirits. We believe they reveal what lies within. It is our honor to help our customers express their innermost selves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, are you certain you want to custom order this particular mask?

Options.PlotLineKey: Well…
(She's suspicious... Will I be forced to reveal my hand...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a very fine mask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I remember correctly, the one Mr. Gilberto picked up last week looked very similar. If it's your first mask, a unique design might be more fitting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have an impressive memory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be on my way now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, we spotted a fellow on the street with a mask that caught our eye… I didn't expect it to be Mr. Gilberto from the Fisalia family.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, they're one of the oldest families in Rinascita. Their ancestors once ignited a war here, but they were defeated and driven out of Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalias are a mixed lot—while some hold honor, others bring disgrace to the name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They show new ambitions. Lately, they've taken to more prominent roles in the city, flaunting their mining ventures and acting with increasing arrogance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, I revised Monsieur Gilberto's mask twenty-three times…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see why it's left a deep impression…

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, given your standing with the Montellis, I'd advise against this design.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why's that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rumor has it the Montellis plan to push for Reserved Echoes at the Carnevale. It's stirred tension with the Fisalia family. Best avoid any association.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That incident with the Montelli's Echoes going berserk... Unfortunate timing. Who knows how this will affect their promotion.

Options.PlotLineKey: I see…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, the trail leads to the Fisalia family.

Options.PlotLineKey: We need to look into the Fisalia family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia's residencies are near the Cathedral of Mercury. We could stop by the Order for more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for the lead, Madame Nyarla. Oh, and we will reconsider the mask's design. Thank you for your time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you're too polite, Mademoiselle Zani. You're my special guest, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't it interesting how a small mask can both hide and reveal? I can't wait to see the "face" you'll choose to show.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to your next visit. This splendid reverie is always open for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At Masked Reverie, you pose as a customer interested in bespoke designs, hoping to gather information about the mask you saw earlier. The shop owner, Nyarla, quickly sees through the ruse. Just as you consider revealing your true motive, a noblewoman steps in to assist you.

You learn that the mask in question was commissioned by a member of the Fisalia family—a man named Gilberto. Rumor has it that the Fisalia Family has been at odds with the Montellis family over issues related to Reserved Terminals.

Since the Fisalia estate is near the Cathedral of Mercury, you decide to pay them a visit and stop by the cathedral to gather further insights from the Order.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola to the Cathedral of Mercury

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ciao, we need to get to the Cathedral of Mercury.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gondolier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it! Please, come aboard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends say the Sentinel quelled the storm and stilled the waves, sparing countless lives at sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To show their gratitude, people place candles around the statue, keeping them lit both day and night. Every boat that passes pays their respects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It may seem fanciful, but it's best to show respect as we pass by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So is this the statue of the Sentinel? Why does it feel weird...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are now in the Fisalia Residencies territory. We should... Wait, look over there…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He looks like the man we saw in Mr. Fulmine's memory. Isn't that Gilberto?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's follow him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you reach the upper level of the Cathedral of Mercury, you spot Gilberto just ahead, slipping inside…
Gilberto, how are things progressing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your trust means a lot, Priest Alessio. The "Flower" has been quite... effective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A word of caution. Don't overstep. We can't afford unwanted scrutiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what I'm doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our sanctuary isn't infinite. Some murmurs are getting harder to quiet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. That's why we seek "unity" and "integration."

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our beliefs are already one. This is also the destiny They intend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Within the Cathedral of Mercury, you see Gilberto secretly discussing something with Alessio, a Priest from the Order…

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, more seekers. What brings you to these halls?

Options.PlotLineKey: We're here to visit Sir Gilberto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir Gilberto...? Oh, Gilberto from the Fisalia family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A pious soul, frequently here in prayer. But not today, it seems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard whispers of you. An Acolyte mentioned your desire to meet the Sentinel. I assume you must be interested in following Their path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I don't think you truly understand the significance of the Carnevale. Allow me to explain.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm interested.
If you must.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've probably heard about the connection between the Carnevale and the Sentinel, but do you know why the Carnevale hasn't been held for years?

Options.PlotLineKey: I have a general understanding.
Is it because of the accident a decade ago?

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the last Carnevale, a sea fog shrouded the entire city. Echoes paraded like lost souls, a dragon roared above, and a beast in the sea stirred up towering waves…

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was sent as punishment and warning against our indulgence and division.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is our Primus, Fenrico, the Enlightened One.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amidst that chaos, he stepped forward and quelled the Sentinel's wrath.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna's greatness was forged from its battles with the sea. It inspired a common goal in all our hearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without everyone working together, land cannot be cultivated, islands cannot unite, and dams cannot be built. A nation's strength lies in its unity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, this is why we preach restraint and control over our desires. Only through rituals can we strengthen our resolve, our unity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is why we must banish those who stray from the right path and impose restrictions on those who threaten the common good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've dedicated ourselves to this cause.

Options.PlotLineKey: It seems like you disapprove of holding the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you misunderstand me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I simply mean that the Order's actions are always made with great deliberation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guided by the Sentinel, we strive to unite and lead the people. We hope to build a kingdom on high, a land of the blessed… As it was in the beginning, and ever shall be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you'll have faith in the Order's judgment. We handle all matters that come to our attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What did you say? How could the Montelli family...

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me, I must attend to pressing matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you have further questions, seek answers in the cathedral. We are always open to those in search of truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I remind you to keep your distance from the sacred relics and honor our customs. Otherwise, we will have no choice but to address any act of disrespect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the Cathedral of Mercury, you're welcomed by Priest Alessio. He denies any connection to Gilberto and instead tells you about the events of the last Carnevale ten years ago: the city was shrouded in thick sea fog, the Vitreum Dancers acted like ghosts, a dragon's roar echoed through the sky, and giant sea monster stirred the waves.

The Order believes it was "divine judgment" on the Carnevale—a warning against people's selfish indulgence. It's clear they don't want you getting involved in the Montellis' recent Vitreum Dancer incident.

Just as you're left uncertain about your next move, news arrives that the Montelli family is making a move. Alessio steps out, leaving you alone in the cathedral…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's got him so rattled that he'd leave us like that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's hiding something. We saw Gilberto enter the cathedral with our own eyes. He couldn't have vanished into thin air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could there be a hidden chamber or secret passage within the cathedral?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you mention it, something's not sitting right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Since Alessio has granted you the freedom to explore the Cathedral, you decide to take full advantage of this rare opportunity.

With Zani by your side, you begin investigating the cathedral, searching for leads...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect the Order to have such a grand garden hidden here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But where could Gilberto have gone? Let's split up and see what we can find.

Chapters.Title: Use Sensor to uncover Gilberto's trail

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did he head that way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the end of the garden… is that a confessional?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like they're slowly finding their way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to rush—I, too, am curious to see what truths await them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The grand revelry draws closer and closer...
Step forward.
What burdens weigh upon your soul?

Options.PlotLineKey: I carry no burdens.
Bless me, for I have transgressed.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you certain? Search your heart.

Options.PlotLineKey: Truly, I have nothing to confess.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you wish to confess?

Options.PlotLineKey: I sleep too much, eat too much, and squander my days in idleness.
I confess that my remarkable good looks have stirred envy and discord.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May the Sentinel grant your absolution. Go in peace, and transgress no more.
Now, I shall open the path to your ascension.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Zani's clues lead you to the cathedral gardens where there is a room that resembles a confessional. To gather more clues, you enter the room.

Meanwhile, Phrolova, the mysterious Overseer of the Fractsidus quietly watches and waits for you to uncover "the path to ascension."
